original_solution_mapping.L1: Jack will have 65-18 = <<65-18=47>>47 pounds of sugar tomorrow.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Jack will have 47+50 = <<47+50=97>>97 pounds of sugar the following day.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6696.
    Returns: the total pounds of sugar Jack will have in the end.
    """
    # L1
    initial_sugar = 65 # Jack has 65 pounds of sugar today
    sugar_used_tomorrow = 18 # he will use 18 pounds of sugar
    sugar_tomorrow = initial_sugar - sugar_used_tomorrow

    # L2
    sugar_bought_following_day = 50 # he will buy 50 more pounds of sugar
    sugar_end = sugar_tomorrow + sugar_bought_following_day

    # FA
    answer = sugar_end
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Jack will have {initial_sugar}-{sugar_used_tomorrow} = <<{initial_sugar}-{sugar_used_tomorrow}={sugar_tomorrow}>>{sugar_tomorrow} pounds of sugar tomorrow.
Jack will have {sugar_tomorrow}+{sugar_bought_following_day} = <<{sugar_tomorrow}+{sugar_bought_following_day}={sugar_end}>>{sugar_end} pounds of sugar the following day.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Jack will have 65-18 = <<65-18=83>>83 pounds of sugar tomorrow.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Jack will have 83+50 = <<83+50=133>>133 pounds of sugar the following day.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
